column4: Hm, my WiFi adapter always shows as eth1 and not wlan0. I already changed things in vi /etc/modprobe.d/aliases
but it doens't help... How the fuck can I fix this ?
whats so wrong with having an interface name eth1 instead of wlan1 ?
well it's a pain in the ass. And the same device shows as wlan0 in Debian, after editing the udev configuration
